home.title: François Michel
home.text: Security engineer intern at SECUTIX

about.title: About me
about.text: My name is François Michel. I am a master student in a joint master program between ETH Zürich and Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Lausanne (EPFL) in Cybersecurity. I did my bachelor in EPFL, including one year exchange in University of Washington. I am currently working at Secutix where I am doing my master thesis. I see myself as a hard worker and fast learner. I am currently looking for a software engineer position where I can grow and learn from experienced team members in a top tech company.

entries.title: Tank Game
entries.contribution: Build an arcade-style tank multiplayer game in Rust where the game controller is a mobile phone connected to the game via WebRTC.

entries.title: Implementation of Blind Signatures for an E-Voting System
entries.contribution: Implement RSA Blind Signatures (IETF RFC 9474) in JavaScript to ensure vote privacy in a decentralized e-voting protocol.

entries.title: Proof-of-personhood System
entries.contribution: Prototyped and implemented a highly robust proof-of-presence group communication and voting app for mobile devices at the Decentralized Distributed Systems Laboratory with 9 other students.

entries.title: Tweets Sentiment Analysis (NLP)
entries.contribution: Built a python Machine Learning classiﬁer performing sentiment analysis on a set of tweets. Achieved 88.2% accuracy, using a pre-trained BERT model combined with multiple pre-processing techniques. Other models were evaluated such as SVM and MLP.

entries.title: Forest Firefighters
entries.description: Project during a summer internship at Cyberbotics
entries.contribution: Implemented a simulation that features a small forest wildfire and a few firefighter robots: a couple of drones and legged robots equipped with cameras.

entries.title: Event Platform
entries.contribution: Designed and implemented a secure event management application using GraphQL Shield and TypeScript.

entries.title: Game boy emulator
entries.contribution: Develept a Nintendo Game Boy emulator in Java, during the EPFL course “Practice of object-oriented programming”.

entries.title: Personal Website
entries.contribution: Built a simple personal website using the web framework Svelte
